Package math

Class Vec3

  • java.lang.Object
    • math.Vec3
  • public final class Vec3
extends java.lang.Object
    3-dimensional vector operations

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      float x
      The three coordinates of the vector
      float y  
      float z  

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Vec3()
      Creates a new vector containing [0, 0, 0]
      Vec3​(float value)
      Creates a new vector containing [value, value, value]
      Vec3​(float x, float y, float z)
      Element-wise construction of vector
      Vec3​(Vec2 vec)
      Creates a new vector containing [vec.x, vec.y, 0]
      Vec3​(Vec2 vec, float z)
      Creates a new vector containing [vec.x, vec.y, z]
      Vec3​(Vec3 vec)
      Creates a vector by copying another vector
      Vec3​(Vec4 vec)
      Creates a new vector containing [vec.x, vec.y, vec.z], omitting 4th dimension

      Clamps each component of this vector to the given min/max values.

      Returns a new vector, with each component of a given vector clamped to the given min/max values.
      Vec3 clone()
      clone method for Vec3
      static Vec3 createRandomPointCone​(Vec3 d, float angle)
      Creates random unit vector of cone in direction d and with given angle IMPORTANT: as parameter the tangent of the angle is demanded!
      static Vec3 createRandomPointOnDisc​(Vec3 v, Vec3 w)
      Creates random vector on elliptic disc, where the principal axes are specified by vector v und w

      Creates random point on ellipse

      Dot product of two vectors
      boolean equals​(java.lang.Object obj)
      Compares this vector with another object (if the object is also a Vec3 make an element-wise comparison)
      float length()
      Calculates length of this vector
      static float length​(Vec3 vec)
      Calculates length of given vector
      Vec3 max​(Vec3 vec)
      Returns a vector containing the component-wise maxima

      this = [0, 5, 1]
      v2 = [3, 0, 2]

      this.max( v2 ) = [3, 5, 2]
      static Vec3 max​(Vec3 left, Vec3 right)
      Returns a new vector containing the component-wise maxima of two vectors
      v1 = [0, 5, 1]
      v2 = [3, 0, 2]

      max( v1, v2 ) = [3, 5, 2]
      Vec3 min​(Vec3 vec)
      Returns a vector containing the component-wise minima

      this = [0, 5, 1]
      vec = [3, 0, 2]

      this.min( vec ) = [0, 0, 1]
      static Vec3 min​(Vec3 left, Vec3 right)
      Returns a new vector containing the component-wise minima of two vectors

      v1 = [0, 5, 1]
      v2 = [3, 0, 2]

      min( v1, v2 ) = [0, 0, 1]
      Vec3 mix​(Vec3 vec, float alpha)
      Linear, component-wise interpolation between this and another vectors.
      Vec3 mix​(Vec3 vec, Vec3 alpha)
      Component-wise linear interpolation between this vectors and another vector with different interpolation factors for the three dimensions
      static Vec3 mix​(Vec3 left, Vec3 right, float alpha)
      Linear, component-wise interpolation between two given vectors.
      static Vec3 mix​(Vec3 left, Vec3 right, Vec3 alpha)
      Component-wise linear interpolation between two vectors with different interpolation factors for the three dimensions

      Multiplies this vector with a factor

      Calculates reflection vector to this vector and a given surface normal

      Copies coordinates element-wise into this vector

      Subtracts one vector from another

      Vec3 toRad()
      changing matrix to string
      java.lang.String toString()
      changing matrix to string
      Vec3 transform​(float w, Mat4 mat)
      transforms this vector (expanded with fourth component w) by a given 4x4 matrix M
      this = M * this', this' is the extended vector This method can be used to transform points (w=1) or vectors (w=0)
      Vec3 transform​(Mat3 mat)
      transforms this vector by a given 3x3 matrix M
      this = M * this
      static Vec3 transform​(Vec3 vec, float w, Mat4 mat)
      transforms a vector v by a given matrix M
      v' = M * v
      static Vec3 transform​(Vec3 vec, Mat3 mat)
      transforms a vector v by a given 3x3 matrix M
      v' = M * v
      static Vec3 xAxis()
      Creates a new vector containing [1, 0, 0]
      static Vec3 yAxis()
      Creates a new vector containing [0, 1, 0]
      static Vec3 zAxis()
      Creates a new vector containing [0, 0, 1]

                                         float angle)
        Creates random unit vector of cone in direction d and with given angle IMPORTANT: as parameter the tangent of the angle is demanded!
        Parameters:
        d - Direction of cone, must be normalized vector
        angle - tangent of the angle of the cone
        Returns:
        random point on cone

      • transform

        transforms this vector by a given 3x3 matrix M
        this = M * this
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • transform

        public static Vec3 transform​(Vec3 vec,
                             Mat3 mat)
        transforms a vector v by a given 3x3 matrix M
        v' = M * v
        Parameters:
        vec - vector to be transformed
        mat - transformation matrix
        Returns:
        transformed vector

      • transform

        public Vec3 transform​(float w,
                      Mat4 mat)
        transforms this vector (expanded with fourth component w) by a given 4x4 matrix M
        this = M * this', this' is the extended vector This method can be used to transform points (w=1) or vectors (w=0)
        Parameters:
        w - value of fourth dimension (=0 for vector, <>0 for points)
        mat - transformation matrix return transformed vector

      • transform

        public static Vec3 transform​(Vec3 vec,
                             float w,
                             Mat4 mat)
        transforms a vector v by a given matrix M
        v' = M * v

      • min

        public Vec3 min​(Vec3 vec)
        Returns a vector containing the component-wise minima

        this = [0, 5, 1]
        vec = [3, 0, 2]

        this.min( vec ) = [0, 0, 1]
        Parameters:
        vec - second vector for this comparison
        Returns:
        vector with component wise minima

      • min

        public static Vec3 min​(Vec3 left,
                       Vec3 right)
        Returns a new vector containing the component-wise minima of two vectors

        v1 = [0, 5, 1]
        v2 = [3, 0, 2]

        min( v1, v2 ) = [0, 0, 1]
        Parameters:
        left - left vector for comparison
        right - second vector for comparison
        Returns:
        vector with component wise minima

      • mix

        public Vec3 mix​(Vec3 vec,
                float alpha)
        Linear, component-wise interpolation between this and another vectors.
        Parameters:
        vec - the second vector
        alpha - the interpolation factor
        Returns:
        alpha*this + (1-alpha) * vec

      • mix

        public static Vec3 mix​(Vec3 left,
                       Vec3 right,
                       float alpha)
        Linear, component-wise interpolation between two given vectors.
        Parameters:
        left - the first vector
        right - the second vector
        alpha - the interpolation factor
        Returns:
        alpha*left + (1-alpha) * right

      • mix

        public Vec3 mix​(Vec3 vec,
                Vec3 alpha)
        Component-wise linear interpolation between this vectors and another vector with different interpolation factors for the three dimensions
        Parameters:
        vec - second vector for interpolation
        alpha - vector with different interpolation factors for each dimension
        Returns:
        alpha*this + (1-alpha) * vec

      • mix

        public static Vec3 mix​(Vec3 left,
                       Vec3 right,
                       Vec3 alpha)
        Component-wise linear interpolation between two vectors with different interpolation factors for the three dimensions
        Parameters:
        left - first vector for interpolation
        right - second vector for interpolation
        alpha - vector with different interpolation factors for each dimension
        Returns:
        alpha*this + (1-alpha) * vec

      • equals

        public boolean equals​(java.lang.Object obj)
        Compares this vector with another object (if the object is also a Vec3 make an element-wise comparison)
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - another object for the comparison
        Returns:
        true: object is equal and has the same values as this vector false: object is unequal
